sect2.title: Introduction to GCC
sect2.para: The GCC package contains GNU compilers. This is useful for compiling programs written in C, C++, Fortran, Java, Objective C and Ada.

sect2.title: Installation of GCC
sect2.para: If you plan to compile Ada, you will need to install GNAT temporarily to satisfy the circular dependency when you recompile GCC to include Ada.

sect2.title: Return to Installation of GCC
sect2.para: Install GCC by running the following commands:

important.para: The installation process may overwrite your existing GCC compiler and libraries. It is highly recommended that you have the Tcl, Expect and DejaGnu packages installed, as well as unpacking the GCC testsuite tarball before beginning the build.

Do not continue with the make install command until you're confident the build was successful. You can compare your test results with those found at . There's also an i686 platform test result produced by an LFS (6.0-testing-20041003) system at . You may also want to refer to the information found in the GCC-Pass 2 section of Chapter 5 in the LFS book.

note.para: Some of the Java programs installed by the GCC package conflict (have the same names) with programs from the package. If you're installing the Java language from the GCC package but you wish to use the programs from the JDK as the defaults, ensure [JDKpath]/bin is listed before /usr/bin in your PATH variable.

userinput.command: patch -Np1 -i ../gcc-&gcc-version;-no_fixincludes-1.patch && patch -Np1 -i ../gcc-&gcc-version;-linkonce-1.patch && sed -i 's/install_to_$(INSTALL_DEST) //' libiberty/Makefile.in && mkdir ../gcc-build && cd ../gcc-build && ../gcc-&gcc-version;/configure --prefix=/usr --libexecdir=/usr/lib \ --enable-shared --enable-languages=c,c++,objc,f77,ada,java \ --enable-threads=posix --enable-__cxa_atexit --enable-clocale=gnu && make bootstrap && make -C gcc gnatlib-shared && make -C gcc gnattools && make -k check && ../gcc-3.4.1/contrib/test_summary && make install && ln -sf ../usr/bin/cpp /lib && ln -sf gcc /usr/bin/cc && ln -sf g77 /usr/bin/f77 && chown -R root:root /usr/lib/gcc/i686-pc-linux-gnu/&gcc-version;/include

sect2.title: Command explanations
sect2.para: sed -i 's/install_to_$(INSTALL_DEST) //' libiberty/Makefile.in: This command suppresses the installation of libiberty.a as the version provided by Binutils is used instead.
mkdir ../gcc-build; cd ../gcc-build: The GCC documentation recommends building the package in a dedicated build directory.
--enable-languages=c,c++,objc,f77,ada,java: This command identifies which languages to build. You may modify this command to remove undesired languages.
--enable-shared --enable-threads=posix --enable-__cxa_atexit: These commands are required to build the C++ libraries to published standards.
--enable-clocale=gnu: This command is a failsafe for incomplete locale data.
make -C gcc gnatlib-shared: This command builds the Ada shared and static libraries. Skip this step if you have not enabled Ada as one of the languages.
make -C gcc gnattools: This command builds the Ada development tools and binaries. Skip this step if you have not enabled Ada as one of the languages.
make -k check: This command runs the test suite without stopping should any errors be encountered.

../gcc-3.4.1/contrib/test_summary: This command will produce a summary of the test suite results. You can append | grep -A7 Summ to the command to produce an even more condensed version of the summary. You may also wish to redirect the output to a file for review and comparison later on.
ln -sf ../usr/bin/cpp /lib: This command creates a link to the C PreProcessor as some packages expect it to be installed in the /lib directory.
ln -sf gcc /usr/bin/cc; ln -sf g77 /usr/bin/f77: These links are created as some packages refer to the C and Fortran compilers using an alternate name.

chown -R root:root /usr/lib/gcc/i686-pc-linux-gnu/&gcc-version;/include: If the package is built by a user other than root, the ownership of the installed include directory (and its contents) will be incorrect. This command changes the ownership to root:root.

sect2.title: Contents
sect2.para: The GCC package contains addr2name.awk, c++, cpp, g++, g77, gcc, gccbug, gcj, gcjh, gcov, gij, gnat, gnatbind, gnatbl, gnatchop, gnatclean, gnatfind, gnatkr, gnatlink, gnatls, gnatmake, gnatname, gnatprep, gnatxref, grepjar, jar, jcf-dump, jv-convert, jv-scan, rmic, rmiregistry and GCC libraries.

sect2.title: Description
sect2.para: The programs and libraries whose descriptions are missing here have been described in the LFS GCC-&gcc-version; page.

sect3.title: addr2name.awk
sect3.para: addr2name.awk emulates some of the functionality of addr2line.

sect3.title: g77
sect3.para: g77 is the Fortran compiler invoked by gcc.

sect3.title: gcj
sect3.para: gcj is an ahead-of-time compiler for the Java language.

sect3.title: gcjh
sect3.para: gcjh generates header files from Java class files.

sect3.title: gij
sect3.para: gij is the GNU interpreter for Java bytecode.

sect3.title: gnat
sect3.para: gnat is the Ada compiler invoked by gcc.

sect3.title: gnatbind
sect3.para: gnatbind is used to bind compiled objects.

sect3.title: gnatbl
sect3.para: gnatbl is the Ada linker.

sect3.title: gnatchop
sect3.para: gnatchop is useful for renaming files to meet the standard Ada default file naming conventions.

sect3.title: gnatclean
sect3.para: gnatclean is used to remove files associated with a GNAT project.

sect3.title: gnatfind
sect3.para: gnatfind is the GNAT definition/use finder.

sect3.title: gnatkr
sect3.para: gnatkr is used to determine the crunched name for a given file, when crunched to a specified maximum length.

sect3.title: gnatlink
sect3.para: gnatlink is used to link programs and build an executable file.

sect3.title: gnatls
sect3.para: gnatls is the compiled unit browser.

sect3.title: gnatmake
sect3.para: gnatmake is an automatic make facility.

sect3.title: gnatname
sect3.para: gnatname will list the files associated with a GNAT project.

sect3.title: gnatmem
sect3.para: gnatmem is the GNAT utility that monitors dynamic allocation and deallocation activity in a program.

sect3.title: gnatprep
sect3.para: gnatprep is the GNAT external preprocessor.

sect3.title: gnatxref
sect3.para: gnatxref is the GNAT cross-referencer.

sect3.title: grepjar
sect3.para: grepjar searches jar files for a pattern.

sect3.title: jar
sect3.para: jar is an archive tool for Java archives.

sect3.title: jcf-dump
sect3.para: jcf-dump prints information about Java class files.

sect3.title: jv-convert
sect3.para: jv-convert converts files from one encoding to another.

sect3.title: jv-scan
sect3.para: jv-scan prints information about Java source files.

sect3.title: rmic
sect3.para: rmic generates stubs for Remote Method Invocation.

sect3.title: rmiregistry
sect3.para: rmiregistry starts a remote object registry on the current host.
